message_1: A delivery company has to deliver 5 packages to 5 different locations. In how many ways can they arrange the packages to be delivered to the locations if each location can only receive one package?
message_2:
This is a permutation problem since the order of the packages being delivered matters. There are 5 packages and 5 locations, so we can use the formula for permutations:

n! / (n - r)!

where n is the number of items (packages) and r is the number of items to be arranged (locations).

In this case, n = 5 and r = 5, so the formula becomes:

5! / (5 - 5)!

5! / 0!

Since 0! is equal to 1, the formula simplifies to:

5!

Now, we just need to calculate the factorial of 5:

5! = 5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1 = 120

So, there are 120 different ways the delivery company can arrange the packages to be delivered to the 5 locations.
